repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
* Match the prefix of the list of the path components.
* Directly rename the existing buffers without deleting them, so that states like undo, window layout, etc are preserved.
* Don't write if not writable.
* buffer:// was removed in 236c20795eb9f11e21e0719b735ea741711acc08.
* Remove redundant custom bufwinid function.
* Fix tests.

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -771,72 +771,97 @@ function M.text_document_completion_list_to_complete_items(result, prefix)
   return matches
 end
 
---- Like vim.fn.bufwinid except it works across tabpages.
-local function bufwinid(bufnr)
-  for _, win in ipairs(api.nvim_list_wins()) do
-    if api.nvim_win_get_buf(win) == bufnr then
-      return win
+local function path_components(path)
+  return vim.split(vim.fs.normalize(path, { expand_env = false }), '/', { plain = true })
+end
+
+local function path_under_prefix(path, prefix)
+  for i, c in ipairs(prefix) do
+    if c ~= path[i] then
+      return false
     end
   end
+  return true
 end
 
---- Get list of buffers for a directory
-local function get_dir_bufs(path)
-  path = path:gsub('([^%w])', '%%%1')
+--- Get list of buffers whose filename matches given path prefix
+---@return integer[]
+local function get_bufs_with_prefix(prefix)
+  prefix = path_components(prefix)
   local buffers = {}
   for _, v in ipairs(vim.api.nvim_list_bufs()) do
-    local bufname = vim.api.nvim_buf_get_name(v):gsub('buffer://', '')
-    if bufname:find(path) then
+    local path = path_components(vim.api.nvim_buf_get_name(v))
+    if path_under_prefix(path, prefix) then
       table.insert(buffers, v)
     end
   end
   return buffers
 end
 
+local function escape_gsub_pat(s)
+  local result, _ = s:gsub('(%p)', '%%%1')
+  return result
+end
+
+local function escape_gsub_repl(s)

comment_data.body: lua-pattern and gsub {repl} are escaped with `%`, but escape() uses `\`

comment_regular_data.body:
The old implementation deletes the buffers that are affected by renaming. Then you will lose the undo information for that buffer, and the windows displaying that buffer will be closed (among many other side effects). I'd like to retain these states even after renaming. 

If you think this is useful, I'll try to fix the missing notification problem. Otherwise, I'll just remove the "Directly rename the existing buffers without deleting them" part of the change.
Oh there's another problem with this change. After renaming, `:write`-ing in the renamed buffer raises E13.

>  Do you disable didChangeWatchedFiles

No I have it enabled.

Based on the specification I'd think it's important that the `didClose` / `didOpen` and other document synchronization messages happen. If this PR prevents that I don't think we can merge it.
I have modified the implementation to utilize the existing `didClose`/`didOpen` logic for `:saveas`.

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: fix(lsp): robust rename()
